cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands, then forecast to bend toward the Bahamas and south-Florida peninsula; could recurve toward the southeastern U.S. coast after day-5
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida / Florida Keys (first CONUS landfall most likely)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend only through Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, SE Bahamas and eastern Cuba – none along the U.S. Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings are confined to the northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and parts of the Dominican Republic.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico Wednesday, Dominican Republic Thursday, Turks & Caicos / SE Bahamas Thursday–Friday, Cuba and Florida by the weekend.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current track remains far south of South Carolina through day-5)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (probability very low while center remains south of FL)
weather_observation.wind: Only a 3 % cumulative chance of tropical-storm-force winds at Beaufort/Charleston by day-5; breezy onshore flow and higher surf possible late in the period.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected through day-5; long-period swells may elevate tides marginally late in the weekend.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall expected at the port through the forecast window.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing rip-current risk and hazardous surf along the South Carolina beaches late in the weekend into early next week.
